header.title: The Scroll of Set (Issue 112)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Magickal Philosophy, Temple of Set Internal Communications

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set serves as a primary forum for advanced Setian discourse, exploring core philosophical tenets like Runa and Xeper, practical magical methodologies, critical analyses of external occult movements (e.g., LaVeyan Satanism) and societal influences, and internal Temple development, all viewed through the lens of individual self-initiation and the pursuit of objective knowledge within the Left-Hand Path.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Runa and the Formula of the Æon
structure_content.summary: This article defines and elaborates on 'Runa' as an Æon-enhancing Word, distinct from Xeper, emphasizing its role in seeking hidden truths within the psyche and objective universe. It acts as a catalyst for the 'Xeper impulse' and guides Setian development through objectivity, with practical advice on its use in communications.

A personal narrative describing an intense, recurring dream experience as a profound subjective magical event, involving a goddess, pleasure, pain, and a 'serpent's kiss,' hinting at deep subconscious and spiritual encounters.

This theoretical piece outlines a framework for influencing others in Lesser and Greater Magic. It stresses the importance of self-knowledge, observing patterns, and exploiting 'loopholes' in collective reality constructions to achieve magical ends.

A series of aphoristic insights into the nature of magic, covering its function through indifference, measuring success via synchronicity, the simplicity of ritual, magic as self-therapy, its reality in the new æon, societal perceptions of magic, the nature of evil, and the paramount importance of personal æsthetics and will.
A brief, poetic description of a mystical experience, conveying a sense of merging with elemental forces (stone waves) and a vision of transcendent reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: [6] Ritual Magic: The 'Flight Simulator' for MetaMind
structure_content.summary: This article explores ritual magic as a training system for the 'MetaMind,' comparing it to a 'flight simulator.' It details how props, symbolism, and emotional intensity are used to explore and refine magical processes (Xeper) under controlled conditions, overcoming subconscious limitations and influencing reality.

An announcement detailing the formation of a local magical forum (Pylon) in Dayton, Ohio, dedicated to the study and practice of the Black Arts, drawing inspiration from the Yezidi tradition of Melek Taus, the Peacock Angel.

A narrative prose poem depicting the journey of a solitary 'Dark Knight' through profound human pain towards self-realization, mastery, and the creation of a unique personal reality beyond conventional human existence, all within the context of darkness.

An exhortation for Setians to engage in self-expression through writing for The Scroll of Set. It advocates for meticulous craftsmanship, self-analysis, and objectivity in artistic endeavors, viewing them as a form of 'Work' within the Temple, rather than choosing 'the easy way'.

A comprehensive analysis of the Temple of Set's foundational principles, contrasting them with the Church of Satan. It details ToS's evolution, unique philosophical orientation towards humanity and initiation, historical challenges (like the 'anti-Satanic' pogroms), and future trajectory, including the aspiration for 'supranationalism'.

A review of John Romer's 'Testament' series and book, which deconstructs the historical development of the Judæo/Christian Bible. It reveals its syncretic origins in ancient Egyptian and Mesopotamian mythologies and its human-driven evolution, thereby demystifying its perceived divine authority and illustrating how ideas shape culture.

structure_content.chapter_title: [12] And if You Believed The Devil's Avenger, I've Got Something Else to Sell You ...
structure_content.summary: A scathing critique of Blanche Barton's 'The Secret Life of a Satanist,' exposing it as a ghost-written, revisionist autobiography of Anton LaVey. It details LaVey's alleged 'prostitution' of the Church of Satan, historical inaccuracies, and misrepresentation of key figures, particularly Diane LaVey, and his subsequent decline.

A critical deconstruction of Carl Raschke's 'Painted Black,' revealing the author's fundamentalist bias, propagandistic tactics, distortion of facts, and ad hominem attacks against 'Satanism' and prominent Left-Hand Path figures, including Michael Aquino and the Temple of Set, likening his methods to historical hate-propaganda.

key_concepts.definition: An Æon-enhancing Word representing a 'secret' deep within the psyche and objective universe, serving as a catalyst for the 'Xeper impulse' and guiding the Setian's quest for hidden truths. It is a map or beacon for the journey of Xeper, operating both from beyond and within the subject.

The dynamic process of 'Becoming' or self-creation, which Runa enhances and aids in defining. It is described as a 'journey,' with the 'actual motion' being the most important aspect for individual progress.

A term used to describe Runa, signifying its ability to augment or deepen the current Æon (Set's Æon), rather than being a modification of the Æonic Formula itself (Xepera Xeper Xeperu), which holds the Temple of Set together.

The inner faculty or mind-state that is trained through ritual magic, utilizing 'flight simulator' methods with props and symbolism to focus the will and cause changes in reality, overcoming subconscious limitations.

A phenomenon distinguishing the objective universe from the 'commonly-perceived universe (CPU).' It posits that willed alterations in an individual's subjective universe can have an effect on the greater CPU.

An Initiate of the Left-Hand Path who overcomes personal 'I can'ts' and trains their will and MetaMind through simulated conditions. They also understand and exploit 'loopholes' (e.g., public opinion, mythical authority) in collective reality constructions to exert influence.

A magical and philosophical orientation focused on individual self-deification, challenging conventional norms, and the pursuit of objective knowledge. The Temple of Set is presented as an LHP initiatory opportunity for Setian intellects.
The occurrence of meaningful coincidences that appear when a magical ritual has 'come full circle,' used as a measure of the ritual's success.

A local organizational unit or magical forum within the Temple of Set, dedicated to ritual, discussion, and sharing of magical knowledge and talents, often focused on specific aspects of the Black Arts.

A term used to describe the fraudulent narrative propagated by certain religious extremists (e.g., Carl Raschke) alleging widespread ritual abuse and criminal activity associated with Satanism, which is critically debunked in the text.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a practical approach to self-initiation and magical development within the Temple of Set, emphasizing individual exploration and the training of the 'MetaMind.' It conceptualizes Runa as a guide for Xeper (Becoming) and provides instructions for 'Reyn til Runa!' as an active quest for hidden knowledge. Ritual magic is presented as a 'flight simulator' to explore, refine, and focus the will, utilizing physical 'crutches' (props, symbols) and emotional intensity to overcome subconscious limitations and influence reality. This system aims to foster proficiency in mental, emotional, and physical abilities to cause desired changes.
tools: Æon-enhancing Words (specifically Runa) as guides for magical development.
Props and symbolism in ritual magic to provide foci for the will and aid MetaMind training.
'Vibrated' words and controlled emotional atmosphere to enhance ritual effectiveness.
Self-analysis, observation, and critical thought as methods for gaining personal truth and identifying 'weaknesses' in reality constructs.
'Loopholes' in collective reality constructions (e.g., public opinion, mythical authority) for influencing others.
rituals: Reyn til Runa!: An exhortation to 'Enquire in the direction of the secrets!' to be included in written communications as a personal quest and encouragement for others to seek hidden truths.
General Ritual Magic: Implied practices involving the use of props, 'vibrated' words, and emotionally charged preparation to train the MetaMind and focus the will.
Greater Black Magic (GBM) ritual: Mentioned as a practice designed to strip away 'safety nets' of delusion and access the 'thing in itself' of the objective universe.

relevant_quotes.text: Runa is the secret which lies deep within the psyche, which corresponds to a secret lying deep within the outer zone of the objective universe.

If Xeper is a journey, then Runa can be a map, a ship, or a beacon to light the way - as well as many other things. But I think we would all agree that the journey, the actual motion of Xeper, is the most important thing.
Runa must always be measured by the strictest codes of objectivity, be they historical, magical, or philosophical.
Ritual in its “highest” form is an act of obsession to ultimately free the magician from further obsession. Thus ritual, when reduced to its barest elements, is therapy: psychic self-surgery.

Magic works. The new æon has ushered in a pinnacle of human existence not seen since the Renaissance or perhaps the German Romantic period. Self-creation is now at our disposal, instead of asceticism.
The Black Magician must therefore overcome the “I can'ts” before dispensing of crutches of props and scripts.
This method of simulator training is therefore a necessary step if we are to gain full and continued proficiency in our mental, emotional, and physical abilities.

The Temple of Set remains, as it has been since its founding, a personal initiative-oriented environment. One does not join it in order to settle back and be shepherded through a program of instruction, indoctrination, or activity.
The challenge to the Temple of Set is not so much to out-duel such elements as it is to prevent them from interrupting our essential initiatory research, workings, and dialogues.

This correspondence, this common framework of law and custom in the Book of Genesis and the cuneiform texts is very deep. The Old Testament's commandments and covenants, their structures and their very subject matter, are often close to the great legal codes of Sumer, the oldest surviving written law codes in the world

Anton LaVey succeeded a bit too well, as by the early 1970s he found himself the head of a nationwide church whose members expected him to lead, teach, and represent them as a religious institution dedicated to the Satan he had so fervently invoked first in hundreds of personal ceremonies and then in his Satanic Bible. For a time he rose to this responsibility, and thereby attained his greatest dignity. In 1975, however, under the impression that the reverence in which he was held was merely admiration for his own personality, he tried to prostitute the Church of Satan into a mere carnival scam by selling the Satanic Priesthood and all higher degrees for cash.
Raschke attacks the Book of Coming Forth by Night as merely “a catty put-down of LaVey” and “a cheap imitation of Crowley's communication in Cairo”.

I suppose I could have more respect for modern Christianity if its proponents argued their point of view courteously and thoughtfully, showing tolerance for if not agreement with contrasting viewpoints [such as ours].

critical_analysis.relevance: This document provides a crucial historical snapshot of the Temple of Set's internal philosophical development, practical magical theories, and external socio-magical critiques from October 1990. It offers deep insights into the Setian understanding of core concepts like Runa and Xeper, distinguishing them from prior occult traditions. The detailed critiques of Anton LaVey and the 'Satanic crime' narrative are historically significant, showcasing the ToS's effort to define itself against misrepresentations and predecessor organizations. It demonstrates a sophisticated, academic approach to occultism, contrasting with more populist or sensationalist views, and highlights the ongoing intellectual and magical work within the order.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Initiates and Adepts of the Temple of Set, serious students of the Left-Hand Path, and academic researchers in Western Esotericism. It assumes a foundational understanding of Setian terminology and concepts, engaging in advanced discourse relevant to the internal dynamics and intellectual progression within specific occult orders.
